âœ¨Miguel Mendoza, an EISD fifth grade student, spent his Saturday at Traders Village asking for donations to benefit a special cause. His campus, L. B. Johnson Elementary School was holding a school-wide fundraiser for the The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society and students were tasked to raise as much money as possible. Miguel decided to go above and beyond.

"I decided to go to Traders Village San Antonio because there's always a lot of people there. I met with a worker and he invited me on the stage," said Miguel. "When everyone heard what I was doing, they all started clapping. The band even donated their tip jar money!"

Miguel says he began early in the morning hours and didn't leave until 6 pm. His passion to help is driven by his little cousin, who is nine years old battling cancer.

"My cousin has cancer so I did it for her. I feel happy to help save lives and help out by raising money. It's the least I can do." Great job Miguel! #EISDStudentSpotlight
